author: DarwinJS
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

LinuxMint is the most Windows 10 like distro.
I have hacked this script to get it to seem like Debian - but it identifies as linuxmint 19 - which does not map to a proper /etc/apt/sources.list.d/microsoft.list.

# Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

I am willing to do this work, but need someone to help validate whether this is a simple mapping problem of mapping LinuxMint to an existing Ubuntu or Debian version, or if there are deeper things like specific packages needed.

A related issue is #6364 - however, I am only concerned with the scope of LinuxMint 19 as a first iteration use case of that issue.

comments.author: DarwinJS
comments.body:
Ok I faked it out to ubuntu 18.4 which linux mint is based on and everything works fine - including VSCode.

Unless someone objects I can just cause this remapping to happen in case statements.

Here are the mappings: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linux_Mint_version_history

Any objections?

title: installpsh-debian.sh should support LinuxMint
